{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question is asking for the standard screening tests that should be performed on all pregnant women, regardless of their risk factors. HIV, syphilis, and hepatitis B are all conditions that can have serious implications for both the mother and the fetus, and are part of routine prenatal screening. Gonorrhea and chlamydia are also important to screen for, but they are typically tested in high-risk populations. Hepatitis C is not routinely screened for in pregnancy unless there are risk factors present.", "answer_choice": "A. HIV, syphilis, and hepatitis B"}
